channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Saint Pierre and Miquelon
item.description: Dave Cross writes about the island that has the .pm domain name extension. They are starting to allow registration by anyone in the EU. Go, grab your own PM domain.

item.title: Beginner Perl Maven
item.description: Announcing the first online video course I started to record. This is for people learning Perl. There is a special discount coupon for those visiting this page in the next day or so. Feel free to invite your friends to use this discount. It expires in less than 3 days.

item.title: 3 quick Dist::Zilla tips
item.description: Oliver Gorwits gave a very short list of 3 Dist::Zilla tips.

item.title: Which Marpa distribution to use?
item.description: Jeffrey Kegler continous his regular Marpa this time explaining about Marpa broadcast. This time he writes about the different use cases of Marpa::XS, Marpa::PP and 'Bare name' Marpa.

item.title: Finding a lost dog's owner with Perl and WWW::Mechanize
item.description: Andy Lester posted an article by Adam Gotch who was trying to access a web site - to help a dog - and wanted to automate the task to save time. A good reason to learn Perl.

item.title: 6 ways to minimize script startup overhead
item.description: Steven Haryanto lists 6 ideas. Some are really good, though I don't agree with all the strategies. I liked the idea of checking the cost of a module using Devel::EndStats (in his pmcost script). Using require for modules that are not used on every run is a clear win. What do you think?

item.title: Parallelism and Test Suites
item.description: Test::Harness allows you to run tests in parallel which can save a lot of time both during module installation and during testing your own application. chromatic shows a few examples where these parallel tests might break and how to fix them easily.

item.title: Know split's special cases
item.description: brian d foy explains 3 special cases of split: the empty pattern, the single space and splitting lines. You can always learn new things and become a more effective Perl programmer.

item.title: Dancing the Haka or How to build a LAN radio station in 3 hours
item.description: Yanick Champoux takes us on a scenic tour with his Maori friends pulling together a streaming server and a web application to have their own radio station.

item.title: Mojito Simply Does MojoMojo
item.description: Mateu introduces Mojito, the document engine he wrote.
